definition: see 失魂落魄[shi1 hun2 luo4 po4]
to lose/to put aside/to throw
old variant of 魂[hun2]
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body
scared out of one's wits (idiom); in a panic
lit. body and soul separated (idiom); fig. scared out of one's wits/beside oneself
distraught/dazed
dazed/beside oneself (idiom)
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
out of one's wits (idiom)/distracted/stunned
to be unable to carry on even for a single day/to be in a desperate situation
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
variant of 張皇|张皇[zhang1 huang2]
flustered/ruffled/disconcerted
to go pale in panic (idiom)
distressed and terrified/distraught (literary)
at a loss (idiom)
convulsed with fear (idiom)
to be distracted
alarmed/anxious
